intro: Hypodematium glabrum, commonly known as the smooth hypodematium, is a small, flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes familiar plants like carrots and parsley. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less commonly encountered species.
